title: Strengthening Instructional Design Competencies: Augmented Reality-Based Dyspnea Symptom Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of Basic Medical Knowledge (Anatomy and Physiology of the Respiratory System)
context.additional_context: Instructional design competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify at least three abnormal lung sounds (crackles, wheezing, pleural friction rub) through AR applications
Learners can explain clinical characteristics by analyzing 3D pathology models for major causes of dyspnea (asthma, pneumonia, pulmonary embolism)
Learners can perform appropriate clinical reasoning with over 80% accuracy in symptom-test-diagnosis linked problem-solving scenarios

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
